content.value_statement: Frontend developers need consistent patterns for React components, data fetching, and routing. This skill provides comprehensive guidelines for building modern React applications with TypeScript, TanStack Query, TanStack Router, and MUI v7.
actual_capabilities: Create React components with React.FC pattern and TypeScript
Implement data fetching with useSuspenseQuery and cache-first strategy
Set up folder-based routing with TanStack Router
Style components with MUI v7 sx prop and responsive patterns
Optimize performance with useMemo, useCallback, and lazy loading
Organize code using features directory structure
limitations: Provides guidelines only, does not generate complete applications
Focused on React/TypeScript stack with specific libraries
Requires existing project setup with supported dependencies

best_practices: Use React.FC<Props> pattern with explicit TypeScript interfaces for all components
Wrap lazy loaded components in SuspenseLoader to prevent layout shift
Apply useSuspenseQuery for data fetching and useMutation for updates with proper cache invalidation
anti_patterns: Never use early returns with loading spinners that cause layout shift
Avoid using any type - use specific types or unknown with type guards
Do not make direct API calls for authentication - use useAuth hook instead

faq.question: Which React version is supported?
faq.answer: React 19 with hooks pattern. Use React.FC for component typing and React.lazy for code splitting.

faq.question: What is the maximum component size for inline styles?
faq.answer: Keep styles inline if under 100 lines. Move to separate .styles.ts file when styles exceed 100 lines.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing code?
faq.answer: Import aliases are configured: @/ for src/, ~types for types/, ~components for components/, ~features for features/.

faq.question: Is user data safe when using these patterns?
faq.answer: Yes. Patterns focus on UI/state management. Authentication uses secure hooks, API calls use HTTP-only cookies via apiClient.

faq.question: Why is my component re-rendering too often?
faq.answer: Add useCallback for functions passed to children, useMemo for computed values, and React.memo for expensive components.

faq.question: How does this compare to create-react-app patterns?
faq.answer: Modern patterns replace CRA patterns. Uses TanStack Router instead of react-router, TanStack Query instead of useEffect fetching, and MUI v7 sx prop instead of makeStyles.
